channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Trump Affiliates Bannon and Epshteyn Named in ‘Let’s Go Brandon’ Crypto Coin Lawsuit
item.description: The creators and promoters of the coin are facing accusations similar to those faced by the “Hawk Tuah” girl.

item.title: Boulanger frappe fort en retirant 20 % sur ce moniteur QD-OLED rafraîchi à 240 Hz, l’écran ultime pour vos FPS
item.description: Avis aux gamers, voici l’écran parfait pour assurer lors de vos sessions de jeux : ce Lenovo Legion 27Q-10 propose une dalle QD-OLED ultra-réactive pour un prix encore plus doux grâce à cette remise de 20 % chez Boulanger.

item.title: Hollywood isn’t happy about the new Seedance 2.0 video generator
item.description: Hollywood organizations are pushing back against a new AI video model called Seedance 2.0, which they say has quickly become a tool for “blatant” copyright infringement.

item.title: Amazon's best Presidents' Day deals under $50 that are actually worth buying — Apple, Lego, Blink, and more from $9.99
item.description: Amazon's Presidents' Day sale is live, and I've rounded up the 18 best deals under $50 that you'd actually use, including earbuds, kitchen appliances, smart home gadgets, and more.

item.title: OpenAI has officially retired the controversial GPT-4o model
item.description: OpenAI's GPT-4o may have survived its first brush with going offline, but it won't be as lucky this time. OpenAI has officially retired GPT-4o, the ChatGPT model that was seen as more conversational and notoriously sycophantic, on February 13. The news of GPT-4o's end was first announced in a post on the OpenAI website in January, but the discontinuation also included GPT-5, GPT-4.1, GPT-4.1 mini, and OpenAI o4-mini from ChatGPT. It's not the first time that OpenAI has delisted GPT-4o as an option for ChatGPT. In August, the AI giant sunsetted the GPT-4o model in favor of rolling out and prior...

item.title: Quelles sont les meilleures montres connectées de sport en 2026 ?
item.description: Véritables compagnons du quotidien, les smartwatches sont aussi compétentes pour monitorer vos séances sportives. Running, cycling, trekking, natation, tennis, yoga... quel que soit votre sport de prédilection, voici notre guide d'achat des meilleures montres connectées pour vous accompagner dans vos activités.

item.title: Lenses too expensive? This lesser-known brand makes awesome, cheap Sony, Nikon, and Fujifilm-fit primes, and these are my favorites
item.description: If you shoot with a Sony, Nikon, Fujifilm or L-mount mirrorless camera and want to expand your lens collection, Viltrox is well worth a look

item.title: Watch the NASA SpaceX Crew-12 mission dock with the ISS
item.description: The Crew-12 mission, SpaceX’s 20th human spaceflight, launched at 5:15 AM Eastern on February 13 from Cape Canaveral in Florida. It’s expected to dock with the International Space Station today, February 14, at 3:15 PM, and you can watch the event below as it happens. By the time the mission’s Dragon capsule docks with the ISS, it will have traveled approximately 34 hours since lift off. Inside are NASA astronauts Jessica Meir and Jack Hathaway, European Space Agency’s Sophie Adenot and Roscosmos cosmonaut Andrey Fedyaev.The four spacefarers are joining the three remaining passengers onboard ...

item.title: A Good Valentine’s Day Gift for These Nice People in the New York Times Would Be to Destroy Their Phones
item.description: Retirement aged people are so addicted to their phones, some of them literally can't talk to each other.

item.title: Designer Kate Barton teams up with IBM and Fiducia AI for a NYFW presentation
item.description: Designer Kate Barton teams up with Fiducia AI and IBM for a NYFW presentation.

item.title: 'I'm grieving': OpenAI has switched off ChatGPT-4o, and angry users are backing a #keep4o campaign to restore it
item.description: ChatGPT users are mourning the loss of GPT-4o, and there are plenty of sad stories being shared online.

item.title: These New ‘Super Mario Galaxy Movie’ Posters Go Galactic
item.description: Get some new, cosmic looks at the heroes and villains of 'The Super Mario Galaxy Movie.'

item.title: '1 second in tens of billions of years': China's ultra-precise optical lattice clock gets international recognition as it challenges US hegemony on time
item.description: China’s optical lattice clock now contributes to global time, achieving unprecedented precision and challenging traditional caesium-based measurement systems.

item.title: MasterClass deal: It's the last day to get 50 percent off subscriptions
item.description: MasterClass has dropped the price of its annual memberships by 50 percent, making it a more affordable way to explore its full library of courses across cooking, business, photography, writing and more. With the discount applied, you’ll spend $10 per month when billed annually for the Premium tier, with lower-cost Standard and Plus options available depending on how many devices you want to use at once and whether you need offline viewing. There are more than 200 classes on MasterClass now, and many are led by big names at the top of their fields. Depending on your interests, you might pick up...

item.title: Rolling Shutter : tout comprendre sur l’effet qui déforme vos photos et vidéos
item.description: Poteaux qui penchent quand vous filmez depuis un train, ventilateur de plafond aux pales « liquéfiées », photo de concert zébrée de bandes sombres… Ces bizarreries visuelles ont toutes la même origine : le rolling shutter. Ce phénomène technique touche la quasi-totalité des smartphones et caméras modernes. On vous explique tout.

item.title: iBuyPower’s gaming desktops are discounted for Presidents Day
item.description: Buying a pre-assembled gaming desktop makes sense for some. It can save you time and money, too, compared to buying PC components piecemeal. If you’re weighing your options, consider some Presidents Day offers on iBuyPower’s pre-built desktops, including the $1,899 RDY Element 9 Pro R07 and the $2,099.99 Slate — both of which are stocked […]

item.title: My favorite League of Legends spin-off since Arcane just got even better – but the upgrade only amplifies my stock availability woes
item.description: My favorite Arcane and League of Legends spin-off just got better.

item.title: With one word, Travis Kelce may have (unintentionally) revealed his retirement plans
item.description: Seemingly small word choices can tell people a lot about what you’re thinking. Will Kansas City Chiefs tight end Travis Kelce retire after this football season? Kelce has not yet delivered a public answer to this question, and there’s widespread speculation. But his choice of words when speaking about this decision may tell us which way he’s leaning. It’s a lesson for every communicator. Your choice of words carries meaning, whether you realize it or not. Sometimes that word choice can reveal more than you intended....

item.title: Homeland security pushes social media giants to dox anonymous accounts critical of ICE
item.description: Four whistleblowers reveal the extent to which the Department of Homeland Security is pressuring social media companies to identify users critical of government policy.

item.title: Georgia Tech announced the finalists in its wild musical instrument competition
item.description: Georgia Tech has announced the finalists in its annual Guthman Musical Instrument Competition. Every year, for the last 28 years, the school invites inventors from around the world to submit new instruments of their own design to compete for $10,000 in prizes. Past finalists have included founding members of Teenage Engineering, Artiphon, and Roli. And […]...
